text: I was surprised to hear that because
that has never been part of any Russian
strategy or part of any Russian policy
on the contrary is something that I've
been telling many people including some
of your colleagues of the media is that
Russia wants a strong and united
European Union a forward-looking
European Union focusing on a better
relationship with my country and perhaps
more independent in its decision-making
next I'd like to ask you about Russian
actions in Syria a top UN official today
has said that crimes and historic
proportions are being committed in
eastern Aleppo and that's a reference to
the air campaign being carried out by
Russia and by the Syrian government
what's your response to that comment
well the restaurants are not bombing
least Aleppo at all yes because both the
Russian Air Force and the Syrian Air
Force have unilaterally stopped there
but you know full well that over the
last few months you've been attacking
eastern Aleppo yes there is still a lot
of terrorist activity in that part of
the city but you know back in August not
so long ago but Sir with respect let me
go you're not killing terrorists you're
killing civilians aren't you hundreds
and hundreds of them we are not
targeting any civilians anywhere I
didn't say you were targeting civilians
but the consequences for instance last
month the UN says air strikes on Aleppo
killed almost 100 children are you
saying that the death of those children
is a price worth paying for Russia's
place on the world stage we're not
talking about Russia's place on the
world stage that's not the aim of what
Russia is doing in Syria what Russia is
doing is assisting at the request of the
legitimate government of that country
assisting its fight against terrorism
I'd also like to ask you about these
Russian naval ships going through the
Channel today can you tell me where
they're going well I would presume
they're on a long-range cruise some of
them may be going to the Mediterranean
which is the closest itinerary between
the Baltic Sea or the northern for the
Russian northern fleet to go but they
are not crossing any state boundaries
would you anticipate they take part in
Russia's military operations in Syria
I wouldn't exclude that
